website_summaries.verdict: All the quality of a name brand bed, at a portion of the cost.
pros: The Amazon Basics elevated pet bed is available in a wide range of sizes
The extra-large size is roughly half the size of a normal twin bed
The base of the bed feels durable, and the reinforced mesh fabric is both breathable and strong
The bed is elevated enough to provide a good airflow, but not so high that its inaccessible
cons: Aesthetically the bed is quite plain

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs who want to avoid Roomba
customer_reviews.text: Pictured: large grey bed with 100 lb yellow lab & 80 lb chocolate lab
customer_reviews.author: Br & Ca

customer_reviews.title: Love the size. Room to spare.
customer_reviews.text: XL Size is huge half of the size of a twin bed. I will update give it five stars once I make sure that it doesn’t have any holes after my German Shepherd uses it for a while. Updated: 03/22/19 still strong and going.
customer_reviews.author: Niko

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Dog loves it! He is 125 lbs and the cot part is sagging a little even though the weight limit is 170. So we shall see how long it lasts, but so far it’s great! Very lightweight and easy to move and comfy for the dog. I was afraid the Large would be too small for him, but it’s perfect! I would buy again especially for the price
customer_reviews.author: MamaG

customer_reviews.title: Nice elevated bed. See pictures for size.
customer_reviews.text: The bed is sturdy, easy to assemble, a much better price than the brand name alternatives. You can see from the photos that the large size is plenty big for a dog about 40 pounds. You can also get an idea of the large size based upon a normal cat size. The cats seem to have taken to the dog bed before the dog does!!
customer_reviews.author: jvanarck

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this!
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these beds in the past that was a different brand, and ordered this as a replacement when that one broke. My dogs LOVE these beds - if there is 3 beds in the room they will take the elevated bed first every time. Keep in the mind that the actual dimensions include the feet, the mesh dimmensions are slightly smaller. I would suggest setting a padded dog bed on top of the mesh so its softer for the dog if you're using this inside. When I have it outside I just use it with the mesh so that it helps them stay cooler during the summer months.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: We had a large size elevated pet bed from a national brand, but our dog outgrew it. Looking for an extra-large, I found the Amazon Basics version and decided to give it a try. The bed frame is simple and easy to install. The bolts seem to be made of harder steel than the national brand alternative, and use a large allen wrench (included) to tighten them down. This is much better than the softer metal with a phillips head on the national brand bed! This bed is less "wiggly" than the national brand. I'm very happy, and so is my dog.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Get the LARGE
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, very nice quality. Easy to assemble and all that. But I REALLY agonized over what size to get... I did not need a twin mattress sized cot, it simply wouldn't fit where I need it to go. He has plenty of room to spare in his crate, and the large was a bit bigger than the crate... so I got medium and boy do I regret it! He -fits- for now but not super comfortably, and he definitely won't fit in a few months... blah! Just wanted to post his story for future shoppers. Pictured is my 50-something pound, 6 month old GSD on the Medium sized cot. If you have a big boy go big!
customer_reviews.author: Tigz

customer_reviews.title: BROKE AFTER 3 WEEKS; PLASTIC PARTS WHERE METAL IS NEEDED
customer_reviews.text: The join of the horizontal bar wit hthe vertical legs bar is made of cheap plastic. We are an animal rescue organization, we have used collaroo beds for many years and have not had one break. This bed broke after just 3 weeks of light use, and could have injured a dog (or dogs). We are hugely disappointed. Amazon Basics is now NOT a trusted brand for us. It's just a few days too late for us to return the bed (didn't set it up instantly), so we're just out of pocket thanks to a cheap design. Do not purchase. It's dangerous and it's garbage.
customer_reviews.author: lynxcat

customer_reviews.title: A Brilliant Product
customer_reviews.text: I only just got this so I cannot speak to the longevity of the item but the initial impressions are fantastic. My Dane mix, while small for his type, is pretty sizable so finding a big enough bed is difficult let alone one that makes him look small. He loves this bed and will spend all day on it if given the chance. He's on palliative care as he's been recently diagnosed as having cancer so this is giving him the comfort he's needed to sleep well.
customer_reviews.author: C Duecy

customer_reviews.title: Great for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that my pomeranian (10 lbs) can be trained to sleep by herself instead of sleeping with me. She has a comfy round bed that is placed on top of this pet bed thingy so that she is comfortable when she sleeps. She seems to like it again and it is the perfect fit for her and her bed.
customer_reviews.author: Bunnie Bun

customer_reviews.title: Nice size & easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bed for my growing puppy. She is a lab/shepherd mix & weighs 65 pounds now. I bought the large size & it is definitely large; it takes up a lot of space, but she will definitely grow into it. If you have a small apartment, this may not work for you. But it was very easy to assemble (less than 10 minutes, by myself). She is still getting used to it, but seems to enjoy it a lot better than old pillow bed on floor. The actual bed mesh seems to be high quality & will hopefully last a while. Overall, nice bed for the price.
customer_reviews.author: RMM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and easy
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product! Love the light gray color. Easy to put together. Medium is great for our 41 lb English bulldog. He loves lounging on it!
customer_reviews.author: adesalvo

customer_reviews.title: Great for overheating dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my pyre/anatolian shep pup who has developed a hygroma on his elbow. He *HATES* sleeping on the couch, dog beds etc because he over heats. Good: Putting it together was simple, easy and fast! Fair price as well. The bottoms also have small pads on them to keep from scratching your floor. The bad: I don't have one aside from my other dogs trying to sleep on it instead of who It's for.. I may need to buy three more :) I have included bananas for scale. I ordered a large. Arthas is 60lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper
customer_reviews.text: This is huge and perfect for a 6month 45lbs German Sheppard mix puppy that will grow. Love how cheap this was. Actually big enough for my 6 yr old granddaughter.
customer_reviews.author: Bib

customer_reviews.title: It helps to have all the parts arrive
customer_reviews.text: The bed was sent disassembled in a box with the pieces loose inside. During shipping a hole came open on the box corner and one of the flat pipes required to hold the legs apart fell out. Our new pup didnt have a bed so I cut a stick to fit the space. That worked for a few weeks until the moisture and pup's chewing pried it loose. Now we have a nice looking pile of pipes and fabric. Materials are simple, but efficient and would be sturdy if all assembled. Dog really enjoyed the bed while it lasted. Amazon did not respond to my shipping complaint so hoping they may see this and send a replacement pipe.
customer_reviews.author: K. Sumtin

customer_reviews.title: Bad Build Design
customer_reviews.text: The frame is out of measurement specifications with the fabric mattress. Tried to stretch it (fabric Mattress) so the frame could be bolted together. 2 grown men could not get enough fabric stretch for the metal frame to be square and bolt holes to match up. Had to shorten the rod by half an inch to make it work. I've built cars, engines and everything in between. Total fail in terms of manufacturers ability to simply get the dimensions correct. This made a 3 minute assembly turn into a small time waistng project. Please, if your going to try and be successful in business....take 5 extra minutes and get it proper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: (Medium Size) Great bed for destructive, crazy dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I too made the mistake of wanting the best for my dog and got her a $120 orthopedic cozy, fluff bed. she ripped the stuffing out within the month of getting it as she was just a year old. shes about 40lbs and 2 yrs old in this picture for scale. this bed helps her stay cool since shes a pure bred husky as well and hasn't found a way to destroy it nor does it appeal to her to try to like her last dog bed did.. I ordered the medium size
customer_reviews.author: BelissaLovely

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts, unhelpful customer service.
customer_reviews.text: It came with 3 screws...so clearly it won't work. I contacted customer service and there is nothing in their "system" that tells what kind of screw it is or how large etc. So the solution...return, rebuy, and rebuild?! Come on. Pack it right the first time or update your "system" so you can at least tell us what screw it is so I can buy it elsewhere. The bed doesn't work without all screws so it barely gets a star.
customer_reviews.author: AllyCat

customer_reviews.title: It does not line up!
customer_reviews.text: What the heck!? There is no way to have all 4 screws in at one time! Yes I even read the instruction and I do have B+E+C. I have all the dipped holes facing out and can not get it to align! I’m so upset! This material is super strong and I cannot just pull the pole closer to align it. If I could share a very embarrassing video of Me pulling on this pole to try and get it aligned I would. Useless without that side so I’ll have to send it back
customer_reviews.author: kori

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and easy to put together. Now we just have to train her to use it
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 43 x 26 x 7.5 Inches for my 50lb mix beast. It was very easy to put together and seems sturdy and well-made. It's a good size for her. I just can't convince her to sleep on it. She'd rather pass out on the floor still! Hopefully, she gets the hang of it, because we'd like to take this camping with us. Baby steps... ✨If my review was helpful, do me a favor and click "helpful" 🤗. Follow my misadventures on instagram @melissajohill
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, fur baby Cannoli loves it and it very content!
customer_reviews.text: My baby Cannoli absolutely loves this bed! Definitely recommend! The moment I started assembling it she wouldn’t stop trying to sit/ lay on it and it wasn’t even built yet lol! Once it was done she was sitting/ playing and even took an afternoon nap on it. Love it! Great quality too! Seems like it’s going to last a while. Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: AnonymousD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Quality product and so easy to put together. Love the grey color as well. The small fits my 22lb frenchie perfectly... she has more than enough room to sprawl out. I can’t wait until summer so she can use it outdoors...for now she lounges on it with her fav blanket. I will be telling all my friends about this pet bed :)
customer_reviews.author: SYLVIA M.

customer_reviews.title: Large is absolutely HUGE!
customer_reviews.text: Normally these beds are insanely expensive at the size of the Large. I live in Arizona where Mother Nature doesn't know it's fall and we still have crazy high temperatures. Our big dogs are old and arthritic so when they go outside it's really difficult for them to lay on the hard ground. These beds are huge, comfortable and seemingly high quality. I don't know how they will hold up to the high heat (they are in the shade so direct sun shouldn't speed things along) but they seem just as sturdy as the ones I paid well over $80 each for! Great beds for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Stutler

customer_reviews.title: Huge! Wonderful my dog thinks he is a king
customer_reviews.text: I got the xlarge. Its huge. Sturdy can hold a human. Not kidding. The frame was easy to put together. The material is strong. I love this.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H. Watts

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how sturdy this is. I got the medium for my shih tzu. I wanted plenty of space for her to stretch out. At first seemed really sturdy. The cloth taut. But now, there is a definite sag in the cloth. I’ve had the product less than 2 months and My dog is only 12 lbs. This product is rated for a much heavier dog. My dog mostly uses this on the weekends when I am not working. The fact that it is already showing signs of sagging is definitely NOT a good sign of durability
customer_reviews.author: Traveller

customer_reviews.title: Stick with the name brand for this one...
customer_reviews.text: Frame broke after having it outside a week (not just a torn cover either), have another one from the actual coolaroo company and other than the cover or actual bed pad which I expected to have to replace as my dog has a habit of digging on his bed the frame has lasted over 2 years in all sorts of weather conditions. Save your money on this one and buy from the original.
customer_reviews.author: Shiprara

customer_reviews.title: Need replacement MESH - Help?!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and big! Easy-ish to put together! My two pitties easily hang on this together! Update May 2019: We bought the XL September 2018, my dogs have torn up the MESH. I can’t find XL, 52.4”x37.4” replacement?! AmazonBasics has every darn size except the XL!?? Not even Coolaroo etc , I cant find it anywhere?! So, dropped this from 5 star to 1 star. Product didn’t last 1 year and no replacement?! Very frustrated that I can’t find a replacement mesh cover - honestly, not looking forward to making a cover.
customer_reviews.author: Jones Family

customer_reviews.title: HUGE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this dog bed. The jumbo is so large my 78lb rough collie has tons of room. He fits perfect in the large if you are looking for size recommendations. I also have a Cool A Roo. The difference is just a couple bucks in price and the Cool A Roo assembles easier. This Amazon one (jumbo) really needs 2 people IMHO but I also feel it is much sturdier! My dogs love them and it keeps them off the mud and dirt in the yard. They are indoor dogs but love to lounge in the sun. The bed while sturdy is also easy to move for when you have to mow. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: happyhome

customer_reviews.title: Way too difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I have bought other cots which our dogs love and ordered this one to put on our deck. I struggled for nearly an hour trying to get the legs to go together. Very frustrating. We have 2 cots made by K&H which are a breeze to put together. This cot was cheaper than the K&H cot but sometimes it's worth to spend the extra $. As usual Amazon returns was a breeze and credited quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Seemingly Chew-Proof, Not Bad Overall
customer_reviews.text: VERY difficult to assemble. But, after my husband & I finally got it together, it seems sturdy. Our dog chews through every bed immediately, but we've had this one for about two weeks now, and he has yet to even chew on it. The fabric part feels smooth & soft. It does slide around on our tile floor, which occasionally makes it awkward for our medium-to-big dog to get on & off, but we just situated it so it can't slide.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the extra large one since I have 3 danes 2 mastiffs and pitty. The one pic shows over 220 lbs of dog on the extra large dog bed and no bending of the metal. It’s so light weight to pick up and move around the house and dust off. It does take up a chunk of space but the dogs love it. I bought a second one and will be buying more. I even bought one for my moms dog in Idaho. So glad I tried it. Dogs loved it better with a blanket tossed on top. Must feel more cozie for them. I only wish it wasn’t made In China.
customer_reviews.author: Rerudkin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the so-called name-brand version of this pet bed and it's OK. But this AmazonBasics version is much better and costs less. There are two key things about the AmazonBasics version that make it superior besides the price: 1. It's easier to assemble because the pieces are better-designed. The crossbars have curved ends to fit better with the long pieces. This makes it less likely to twist out of shape later. The hardware in general seems to be of a higher quality. 2. The fabric of the cot is heavier-duty and looks like it will be much more sturdy. The name-brand's cot's fabric quickly wore thin and developed holes. All in all, this is a superior product.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great size for a bulldog
customer_reviews.text: Me and my wife got this because our English bulldog seems to urinate on her bed every night during the winter whether the apartment is cold or warm. The cost of cleaning her cushy bed every day is pretty expensive. So we decided to get her this cot. Easy to assemble comfortable and if there’s an accident very easy to clean no need to take it to the laundry mat. At first I didn’t know if the size would be a good fit for her but once we got it it was definitely bigger than expected. We purchased the large which is roughly 34X31.
customer_reviews.author: cesar escobar-cueva

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t yet put outside but my cat enjoys this bed inside. Bought the XS for my large cat and sprinkled catnip on it for interest.
customer_reviews.author: Quiet Nature Lover

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, an XL for a 70lb dog, and LG for the 45 lbs. Good fit. These aren't going to last forever, and outside would likely become rusty over time however, they are of decent quality especially for the price. We are using ours only for the kennel so the pups don't have to be on the concrete. They are used to Ballistic memory foam beds -- more flat and firm but I don't want those soiled or exposed at the kennel. The nylon "hammock" will likely stretch and sag more which will make beds seem smaller. Still, these beds with some favorite blankets are working well for those trips to the doggy hotel
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top Tier Dog Bed
customer_reviews.text: Pictured are a 70lb and a 12lb pair of doggos. They are on the large model. Clearly I could have safely gone with a medium, but picturing measurements is not among my skills. It was simple to put together, even with a toddler trying to "help" me. My large rescue dog's long nails (he panics when anyone tries to trim them) have not punctured or damaged the fabric at all. It being elevated means that my old, little dog does not pee on it, unlike literally every other dog bed we have ever bought. My kids (40lbs and 30lbs) enjoy sitting on it, as well as jumping on it, and it has neither bowed nor broken. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: mediocrenerd

customer_reviews.title: Super durable
customer_reviews.text: My pup likes to chew on everything! He typically destroys stuff within a day. I purchased this about 2 months ago and it’s still standing. It’s really sturdy and can hold up to 170 lbs. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in this product. The legs seem to be somewhat durable, not at all the fabric though. It has only been almost been 2 months since Ive received it and it’s already starting to tear all the way around even though it took my dog about a month to actually start laying in it. I wouldn’t consider it soft at all. My dog didn’t try to chew it but I gave chew proof 1 Star because if the material rips this fast just by laying on it I can’t imagine how fast the dogs can chew threw it if they did. It’s very easy to clean though, I’ll give it that!
customer_reviews.author: Vitalina

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this dog bed in addition to a cover for it for my dogs to use outside, to keep them up off the hot ground and provide air circulation around them. Added the shade to keep the material from getting sun rot and to help the dogs stay cool, of course :) The dog pictured is a 65 pound Afghan Hound and the cot has no problem holding him. The dog behind him is 95 pounds and this cot is a little small for him, so he prefers to use another cot we have that's a little larger.
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: Just what my dog needed - indoor and outdoor
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the jumbo size for my lab mix puppy and Italian greyhound. It is say to assemble, durable and easy to clean. I use it outside on my deck and sometime put a large dog bed on it. My dogs immediately took to it. Puppy had fun playing on it with a handful of ice cubes. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: LNK

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This bed is very durable as you can see from first picture held both of my pups for a very long time, about 200lbs. They love this bed and lay on it continually when outside.
customer_reviews.author: danny

customer_reviews.title: Too High Off Ground/Floor
customer_reviews.text: I really like everything else about this bed but its so high off the ground and my chows won't get on it because of that. Not sure why they think they have to make it so high. Makes zero sense being up so high. If it were like 2 inches off the floor but 6 inches? Other than the fact that the dogs don't use it, its bigger than I expected and easy to put together but losses 2 stars for being so high the dogs won't get on it so its useless for me.
customer_reviews.author: Official Best

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love!
customer_reviews.text: My shepherds LOVE this!! This is the second time I have gotten them. The first time they lasted about a year, but the price is fair so I dont mind. I bought a large for my 75 lb, and an extra large for my 125 lb. The extra large is HUGE!!! I could have just bought two larges. They are easy to put together. My shepherds both have really bad arthritis and I have noticed that these are easier for them to get up on, rather than the hard ground or grass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple assembly if properly drilled and measured.
customer_reviews.text: Product returned due to assembly issues. The poles and holes didn't match up. I was impressed with the durability of the fabric and hopeful that the replacement will assemble properly. Update: the replacement proved just as difficult to assemble but we were able to finally get the poles to line up enough to get the bolts in. It was a work out.
customer_reviews.author: LHarvey

customer_reviews.title: My dog is comfy on this bed, but prefers a blanket with it
customer_reviews.text: We adopted a rescue dog recently. I chose this bed because it looked a lot like the ones at the shelter, where she laid on the cot the whole time instead of jumping around like the other dogs. I hoped having a similar bed at home would help her transition easier, so she would immediately understand it is her bed. And she did, but we discovered she likes it better with a blanket. We noticed she was lying on the carpet next to the bed a lot, until we put a blanket on the bed and now she spends a lot of time lounging on it.
customer_reviews.author: Harmony

customer_reviews.title: Great for my GSD puppy!
customer_reviews.text: This bed was super easy to put together, it took less than 5 minutes from start to finish. All hardware was included, along with an Allen wrench. I bought this for my 4.5 month old GSD puppy as a bed and training tool. He's put it through its paces, jumping on and off and flopping himself down on it when I tell him to lay down. He currently weighs 45 pounds, so he's far from full grown but the bed looks as good now as it did when it arrived. When I need another, I absolutely will buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Doggirl211

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this item before. It is a very good product. Better the coolaroo. The material lasts and when it wears, you can buy the cot without the frame. My dog doesn't tear them up, but they do begin to sag after a while. Because of the sag I have to purchase the cot without the frame. Also, the new sizing is quite a bit larger. I purchased a new cot with frame because of the new sizing. I probably could have purchased a medium that would've been big enough. I have a 55 lb Weimaraner.
customer_reviews.author: zEPoL

customer_reviews.title: Sophie approved...better than the expensive bed...Amazon man saved my sanity.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not what I like, it’s what she likes. I had bought her a different brand, same style “cheap” mesh bed to try, having never had one. She loved it. But the frame broke badly. I went to replace it with an expensive model. She did not approve. I mean she screamed at me 24/7 until Amazon man saved the day, my ears, and my sanity. She’s here or on my bed...which she was offered but refused until the day after this bed arrived. She has mobility issues but will figure out how to get herself to her bed if so motivated....even off mine. It is Sophie approved. I don’t know about chew strength. She isn’t a chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Farfa

customer_reviews.title: Great for large dogs..or, apparently, goats!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for our Great Pyrenees livestock guardian dog, but she hasn’t had much chance to use it because it’s become a favorite hangout for the goats! Easy to put together, easily wiped off, and very sturdy; the large size holds our 110 lb Great Pyrenees or two 50 lb goats just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: X-L is HUGE!
customer_reviews.text: I did have the measurements, but I erred in ordering this. I am 5'1" and I could almost sleep on it comfortably. It is definitely Irish Wolfhound size and not the Labranewf size I needed. My dogs are older and I thought they would like a respite from the heat, but they don't like being on it. Personally, I find it plenty comfortabe and stable and think they are missing out, but try and convince them of it! I knew it was a gamble when I bought it and it's quite a fair price for the quality. I would like to return it, but I missed my window of exchange time. I'm still not sorry I tried it for $30.
customer_reviews.author: NiPH

customer_reviews.title: Dog Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit, I was skeptical about the quality at first given the price point, but Amazon Basics hasn't let me down before. They've pulled it out again with this product. Easy to put together and is holding up well to daily outdoor use, including some light snow in Chicago. Stays put in the wind too. Fits my 78lb lab with plenty of room for all the toys he seems to accumulate out on the patio. He took to it right away despite being picky about his lounge spaces. Can't recommend this bed highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Carys O.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought only the large because this thing is pretty big. My 90lb GSD mix had plenty of room to spread out and apparently it is comfortable because he was snoring mere minutes after curling up on it. The only downside is trying to put this thing together. Because the bed is tension based, it can take some strength to get the rods to align properly in order to screw them together.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Dreams
customer_reviews.text: We had purchased a pet bed from a well known out door store for a much higher price and our lab chewed it up in a couple of months. This bed not only is a better price, but it is sturdier, and he hasn't chewed any part of it. It says it is a cooling bed but currently he uses it even though it is November. We simply put an orthopedic mattress on it and he loves it. It is light enough weight that it is very easy to pick up to clean the dog pen yet it is strong enough to hold our 100 lb lab.
customer_reviews.author: bear

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: Based upon all the positive reviews, I decided to purchase this elevated bed over the name-brand version or the PVC pipe version. Not sure where all the positive reviews are coming from, but this bed was awful. I put it together quickly and easily but it would not sit straight. I tried loosing the screws and tightening the screws but every change just made this bed worse and worse. It just will not lay flat on the floor and, if you touch it to try and straighten it out, it just becomes more cockeyed. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: SueE

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my mini horse!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon shipped me one that was already used. Even so it was IMPOSSIBLE to put together even with 2 very strong adults as the mat didnt stretch far enough. I see why it was returned the 1st time. That said, my old boy loves it. He loves to sit outside and watches the neighborhood in comfort instead of his bones on the hard ground. It’s very large too which I was worried about as he is evidently is mostly bloodhound with beagle (just his colors are beagle, either way what an interesting couple his parents must have been!) he’s pushin 95lbs of mostly muscle and wrinkles but it’s held up very well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H.

customer_reviews.title: Love it and so do my black beauties!!  Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bed and so do my pups!! This is the first elevated bed I have bought so I was a bit leary about my dogs using it but they jumped right on and have loved it ever since! Both of my labs (65 and 60 pounds) and they both fit on this perfectly! Putting it together was a breeze and it is good quality! I would highly recommend and I am actually giving my guide dog training school this product to buy for all newly placed guide dogs... it is way way cheaper than the ones they provide and equal or better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nellie-- a blind shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but my dogs don't like it.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this bed about a week, and so far my dogs don't like it. My 11 year old Shepherd will actually take the floor rather than lie on it. However, it is sturdy, easy to clean with no stuffing to get soiled, would be hard to tear up, and just generally is good quality. So, the dogs are stuck with it. I am sure once they get used to it they will be fine...and I am sick of replacing beds.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the large pet bet for my 45 lb terrier/lab mix and he loves it. Looking at it now I definitely think that he could easily have fit the medium, but I plan on putting a heating pad on one side so the extra room will let him choose which side to lay on. He got onto the bed immediately after I finished putting it together (unusual for him, since he is normally afraid of all new things) and has been picking the bed over our recliner regularly. Overall very pleased with this product. May buy another one for my porch (current one is in the living room).
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Nice and useful
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice quality off the ground type dog bed. Well worth what I paid for it. I have also had the original coolaroo similar dog beds. The fabric on this one is tighter so dirt doesn't fall through it so have to actually brush off the dirt-not a big issue. These types of beds are not soft, I put a blanket on it and my dog like that. Definitely chewproof. I have one dog who likes to paw his bedding. In time this will cause damage but it should hold up very well. I expect it to be useful for at least a couple of years. Very good purchase. Happy
customer_reviews.author: janie

customer_reviews.title: Best elevated bed!!
customer_reviews.text: My boxers LOVE these. I ordered 3 XL beds. They are made of a canvas material. I ordered one of the cooleroo elevated beds and returned to get this type. The material is so much more sturdier in these than the cooleroo beds. The material on these reminds me of an outdoor awning material. Very tuff. The material on the cooleroo beds reminded me of what an onion bag from the store is made of! I know that’s a weird comparison but that’s what it felt like. I felt that my dogs nails would destroy it quickly. Amazons bed is definitely the best one! I hope they keep these in stock!
customer_reviews.author: SBryan

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my big gal! Allows her to stay cool and comfy!
customer_reviews.author: G.S.W.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble. Medium is plenty big enough for our 55lb pupper. West Texas is HOT during the summer so we don’t leave him outside if we don’t have to. He does seem to like his elevated bed. We have it in the shade of our patio. He likes to lay on it in the morning when the sun is still hitting the other side of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Abel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean; does not accumulate hair or smell!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for a bed that is comfortable but also easy to clean for my non stop shedding American bulldog. His hair gets stuck in every cloth bed we’ve ever had for him and it’s impossible to clean. I’ve been washing his beds in the past but that gets our washer incredibly hairy. So cloth beds are just not an option anymore. This one seems to fit the bill for easy cleaning, since the material doesn’t allow the hair to get stuck on it. Just wipe off and done. No smell or hair to congregate on the actual bed. We got the XL for our 118lb bulldog. Fits comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Ana M. Dolaskie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Elevated Bed!
customer_reviews.text: Bed is great! Purchased for my German Shepherd who is a rescue and is scared of just about everything which meant this bed also terrified her. So I gave it to my parents who have a 13 year old 85 lb. lab who loved it! Saved his old bones from getting on and off the hard wood (for some reason he would always plop on the wood instead of the carpet...). We put his cushion bed on top of this one and he slept on it all the time. Has held up well so far and is a decent quality considering they sell this bed for twice as much other places.
customer_reviews.author: megman

customer_reviews.title: Very tough bed and easy to keep clean.
customer_reviews.text: These are the only beds that my dachshunds are not able to destroy in days. They chew EVERYTHING I get them, but these will last a very long time. The bed is very strong and able to hold a lot of weight. My Newfoundland will climb on the dachshund's beds and they still hold up. She has her own, which she loves, but that doesn't stop her from trying to use their beds. I put blankets on top of the dachshunds beds so they keep warm. The bed is easy to clean when the dachshunds decide to pee on it. It wipes off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Platic Bolt Anchors Failed
customer_reviews.text: The metal tubes are secured to each other by screwing a bolt with an alan wrench into a metal nut that's impregnated in plastic and pressed into the hollow pipes at each corner. When the plastic fails one any of the four corners of the metal frame, the cooling bed is no longer useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Seabarkrob

customer_reviews.title: Steal your dogs bed?
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes this more than couch during hot summer days. But that's not why you came to read this review. .. I am a 6 ft 2 in 170lb man. I found myself without a bed or couch while I was between moving. I did however have this dog bed. Now, my dog (80lb lab/done) was a bit peeved at first but tough, I sleep where I wanna. Anyways, long story short, we both managed to sleep on this. For a whole week. No sign of damage. Honestly I'm impressed, it was comfier that expected. I wish it was longer though so I didn't have to hang my legs off
customer_reviews.author: Eric Dalsing

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: We bought this bed for our dog to go when we put him in "place" when company arrives. He has never been interested in having a bed, but he likes this. He doesn't mind staying on it when we have guests, and has started seeking it on his own as a place to relax. It is sturdy and well constructed. Our boy weighs 60 lbs and it is a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pet Approved
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the small bed as my little girls are small. 8lb Yorkie, 12lb Chihuahua (small to me) for reference. Assembly was EASY. 4 screws and hex key (allen wrench) are provided. Took me less than 10 minutes to put together. Neither of my girls chew on things, so I can't attest to it's durability. But...Pictures speak a thousand words. Both of my girls took to the bed quickly and spend their days snoring away! Material is mesh like? Breathable. Figured cleaning would be easy. Haven't had to clean it yet, but I'll spray it down and hose it off. Overall happy!
customer_reviews.author: RockstarBaby

customer_reviews.title: It sags a bit but the dog likes it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bed for summertime use because my dog would not use her soft memory foam bed and has been sleeping on the hardwood floor during the hotter days. The bed is easy to assemble and my dog is ok with its construction. I called her over after it was fully assembled, and she stepped on it with caution and then lay down. My dog is a full-size golden retriever that weighs 74lb and she fits perfectly on this bed. The only negative thing I noticed was that the bed seems to be on the stretchy side, because it does sag a bit when she is on it. However, my dog seems to be ok with it.
customer_reviews.author: yishin

customer_reviews.title: Nice beds
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble and dogs love it! Medium was plenty big for my 60lb malinois.
customer_reviews.author: BLT

customer_reviews.title: Green is better to hide dirty paw prints, and L size can fit 85 lb Airedale no problem
customer_reviews.text: This is a good elevated dog bed that both my dogs have used- they are 50 lbs and 85 lb dogs- both fit just fine on this large-size dog bed. I prefer it over the XL size (which I also have) bc it’s just much easier to fit this dog bed on our lanai. It seems durable enough- hoping it lasts at least a year in our covered outdoor space. The green is MUCH better than the gray. I don’t know why I got gray for the XL size. It’s covered in muddy paw prints from the dogs as they walk over the gray one to the green one to settle in.
customer_reviews.author: Megs

customer_reviews.title: Tripping hazard
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this bed but unfortunately it seems that I cannot walk by it without tripping on the legs that extend past the actual sling bed. It’s some kind of optical illusion. As much as I tell myself that I’m going to be careful and walk around it, I end up slamming my toes into the legs or full on hitting the ground. Hate it. Thinking about replacing it. I purchased a smaller unit that had legs that are straight up and down and have never tripped over that one. Would not recommend the curved legs for anyone that is as clumsy as I am.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Murray

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t tell the difference between AmazonBasic & Coolaroo elevated dog bed
customer_reviews.text: In the past couple of years, I’ve purchased Coolaroo elevated dog beds. I usually replace the bed cover every 9-12 months (pending how destructive my Boxers have been with it). I had a problem disassembling the Coolaroo poles as two of the Philip head screws had become rusted & stripped. The AmazonBasic was a few dollars less than the Coolaroo & I decided to go with AmazonBasic. When assembling the dog bed I noticed it came with hex head crank arm bolts & not Philips pan head screws. I was very pleased as I would be less inclined to strip any Philip head screws. I would definitely recommend AmazonBasic.
customer_reviews.author: C Ko

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as I’d like it
customer_reviews.text: I waited quite awhile to write a review on this because I know there were some reviews about the netting sinking and poles bending, etc. the material is nice but it does sink quite a bit. I ordered the largest size for my dane puppy and hound mix and they both like it. I’ve had it for multiple weeks now although it hasn’t been used constantly the middle has still sunk in. It’s also not very sturdy as the poles shift significantly. My two dogs like it though and my cat will even lay on it every once n awhile. It’s a nice spot for them to be able to get away and chew on bones in peace, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great elevated bed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bed for our German Shepherd. She weighs just shy of 100 lbs. I wasn't sure if this was going to hold her based on the looks of it. I was very surprised it holds her very well. I love that it keeps her off the floor whether hot/cold or wet. Definitely happy with this. I can't vouch for it being chew proof because she doesn't seem to have any interest in chewing at it which is good. I would say this is a great buy and of decent quality. I would definitely purchase it again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: S Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This is worth every penny. We live in the South where it’s very warm most of the year. My dogs love laying on this when they’re outside. It’s been outside for over 6 months. While it does have a bit of rust on the metal the fabric has held up so far. We bought the biggest bed and I’ve caught all three of my dogs (Goldendoodle, Catahoula and Great Pyrenees) laying on it at once. The fabric is very similar to a trampoline bounce pad. Easy to spray with a hose. This is a fantastic dog bed!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Kooi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: These have held up fantastically! I have one for each of my 3 large dogs now. The knit is tight and water resistant so expect some puddling if it rains. They dry quickly once swept off though. There is very little sagging and no weathering issues at all through 2 winters. The dogs love them and it keeps them off the concrete. I can't believe how much money I wasted on another "top quality" brand, buying replacement covers every few months. These are way nicer on the bank and well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: I’m glad I got this one
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews, looked at a lot of pictures, and compared lots of similar products (even on Groupon). This one had the best reviews, overall, and the best price. I have two Boston terriers, both 20-25 lbs. I was debating which size to get. Not having a lot of space I decided having two smaller beds would be easier than one big one. So I got one small to see if they like it and use it. So far they do, so I’ll probably be getting another one. It was super easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great beds.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my dogs. They love it. The floor was cold even with their beds so they would always get up on our bed during the night. Now that we got these and put their beds on top they LOVE it and run to their beds at night. It seems like they try and race each other to bed because for some reason they both want to sleep in one over the other and whoever gets there first gets to sleep in that one. I think it will be nice in the summer as well when it’s warm and they don’t want all their bedding
customer_reviews.author: A. Tea

customer_reviews.title: Just order it! Your companion will love you!
customer_reviews.text: I really underestimated this bed! I ordered the extra large after pondering on it for months. My boy is a Great Pyrenees weighing about 135 lbs so I went off of his weight. I did not expect this this to be half the size of a queen sized bed! He really does love it at night! The breathable technology is amazing especially when he normally lays on the floor to get the cool air. He also has so much room to sprawl out. Lightweight and very easy to set up against the wall for cleaning underneath!
customer_reviews.author: BCJ

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your pet off the floor.
customer_reviews.text: When you buy a regular pet mattress, try sitting on it first. If your butt feels the floor through it, your pet will too. It's basically useless because your dog is still putting weight on those pressure points. If you put that mattress on this suspended pet bed, the hardness of the floor is eliminated. There will be the support of the fabric through the cushion which is softer than hard floor. At least that's my observation. And it's off the cold floor in the winter. My dog seems to like it.
customer_reviews.author: Scylla

customer_reviews.title: Great Elevate Bed, Not Very Soft Though
customer_reviews.text: Neither dog would use this bed when we first got it... until we put a blanket on it. Kind of defeats the "cooling" purpose, but it's still better than a plush bed that they can rip up (they won't tear up the blanket) so still a solid purchase. Not soft, but easy to put together and adding the blanket did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Karate

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good -- Dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these to replace several large, throw-pillow style dog beds that smelled, collected hair, and were next to impossible to clean. It took a couple of days, but our dogs now love these beds. We use them indoors on porcelain tile flooring. They haven't scratched the floor. They are easily moved, easily vacuumed, and don't reek of dog (so far). Our heaviest dog is 72 lbs, and the fabric is taking the weight very well. One of our dogs has hip problems, and he is able to get on and off of the beds with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: GulfCoastRetired

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Coolaroo
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one after the weather and my dogs destroyed the Coolaroo I had. I wasn't expecting it to be as good, but it was cheaper so I thought I would give it a try. It's definitely much larger than the one I had previously and was much easier to assemble. The material seems more durable as well and it washes off very easily. It has held up really well outside with three dogs using it (because everyone wants to sit on the same one). I would definitely recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: K. Tolliver

customer_reviews.title: Works great as advertised
customer_reviews.text: What can I say Dogs love it bought it for my doodles to lay on while outside keeping them off the ground and can set it in the rocks off the patio so they are not under people's feet! Plus frees up space on my patio as at times can be very busy with people! Works great! Went together very easy just a hint keep screws all loose till all screws are in place then tighten them all down! I can see it would be great for traveling camping very light weight and appears to be very durable.
customer_reviews.author: BJD

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Coolio elevated bed in the past, but it was only rated to 110. I needed a bigger one this time so I purchased this one. It is a great size, even larger than what I needed. Seems to be sturdy so far. My only complaint is the cover is a very slick surface. My GSD much prefers the texture of the Coolio cover. He still tries to use it because he slides all the way off of this one during training exercises. It is still a great product even with that flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: My dogs shred anything with stuffing
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love stuffing and when the water table is high I get leaks in the back wall. This bed keeps the bedding and the dogs off the floor and dry, and while the dogs did manage to shred one of the bed covers the other is still in pristine condition and they sell replacement covers, so I still have 2 functional beds - unlike every bed I have purchased that had filling. They occasionally got wet - if they survived long enough before they were turned into a pile of stuffing.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Love these.....
customer_reviews.text: more importantly my dogs love them. I bought one medium (50 lb dog) and one large (75 pound dog). They just went through obedience training at the age of four and doing an outstanding job with the commands ("place" for example). They will sit or lay down on them upon command and stay there. I see where these will be beneficial in the summer sun to add to their coolness in the yard too. Easy to put together, seem very sturdy and a breeze to clean. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been using this bed for about 2 weeks . She was skeptical and confused about it at first but once I showed her it was a bed she started using it . She seems to like it ... keeps her cool and comfortable. The mesh is holding up good so far and frame seems strong . It does make some noise from the mesh moving on the bars when the dog is standing and moving on it but it doesn’t bother me . My dog is a 40 pound lab chow mix and I got the medium size
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Good Value with a few Caveats
customer_reviews.text: Solid product but my dog won't sleep on it. Kind of difficult to assemble because the longer sides seem to be a bit too big for the cloth cot. Took two people and a lot of effort to get it to fit together. Also could use some rubber feet to prevent it from scratching the floor. Over all it's a good value for the price just make sure your dog isn't stubborn like mine.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Wubben

customer_reviews.title: Jedi approved
customer_reviews.text: Jedi used to come running to us whenever we were in the yard. Now she sits on her throne, indifferent to her subjects who must come to her. She loves it. We have artificial grass which gets quite warm in the summer, and I think this pad really does help the Queen keep cool. It's easy to put together, is solidly made, has been outdoors for a month now and shows no signs of deterioration. Jedi is a chewer, but nothing about this pad has interested her.
customer_reviews.author: toy train lover

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor purchase for the dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it's chew proof yet or how chew proof it is but so far my dogs are questioning it. We have three large dogs and we wanted something for them to lay on outside other than rock and concrete. One of my dogs warmed up to it right away and has laid on on three to try them out. They were larger than I thought. Assembly I think should take two people just to hold it properly when screwing it all in. The material felt great too and I think it is easily cleaned off with a hose and set out to dry. Ours is meant for outside.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: It’s still surviving. Dogs have taken to it too, and I catch them snoozing on it every day. Great investment for me Update: it’s been a couple of months, and it’s still holding up. My American bulldog weighs around 130lbs (overweight I know), but the bed doesn’t seem to be in distress. No loose ends. Great bed for outside dogs. Very pleased. My young Boston terrier took a bit to take to hers, but after putting it in a better spot, she loves it. They both take an afternoon nap on it every day
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Varela

customer_reviews.title: Not destroyed in two days!!
customer_reviews.text: Thought maybe my 45 lb Airedale mix would prefer this bed to the floor. We purchased the medium and it is a great size Added bonus, she can't eat it like all the other beds we have bought her. She will use it--generally after one of the cats has decided to nap on it. Added bonus, my 6 year olds can also sit on it (which the manual says I should not allow). It can hold up to 150lbs, according to the manual. It was pretty simple to put together and seems solid.
customer_reviews.author: F. Mercer

customer_reviews.title: A nightmare to put together, but good once assembled
customer_reviews.text: Clearly I am one of only a few people who received a slightly defective item as the reviews are mostly positive. The fabric portion of my dog bed was too small for the frame. My husband eventually shaved off a portion of the metal frame so that the fabric would fit into the frame. I'm assuming this is a quality control issue on the fabric manufacturing. Now that it is assembled, it is great, but I would not order this again because of the issue we encountered.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mulkey

customer_reviews.title: Rating seller not the product
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't specify that is used and mine came dirty, beat up, no packaging, missing all screws or bolts, dirty or soiled prob by a dog, no instruction manual and the dimensions were way off. If it was new and the right size and complete. it looked like it would had been a nice outdoor summer bed for my old Bob.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have chewed up every bed we've bought them so we decided to go with this cot after recommendation from the kennel were they use cots for overnight stays. I am very pleased with the purchase of the cot/bed. We have 2 french bulldogs weighing approx 23 lbs each. The cot is very sturdy, the large size was a perfect fit for our space and have them both on their comfy and roomy. It is sturdy and easy to clean. They have yet (hoping it stays this way) to chew it up. I recommend this cot 100%. Also very well priced in my opinion as I've seen others that look the same for much more.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi M.

customer_reviews.title: Super-sad it’s broken! ☹️
customer_reviews.text: I just put the dog bed together, but one of the holes is stripped - the screw goes in and connects to the other piece all the way, but it just turns in the hole - it never gets tighter. ☹️ It’s super-wobbly, and I’m afraid if my Great Dane stepped on it and shifted to another position, it would come crashing down. It is NOT stable whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for dog owners. Stellar product!
customer_reviews.text: Literally cannot recommend enough. We purchased 3 large pet beds from a different seller less than a year ago and one of them was already done. So we ordered one of these because the jumbo size was less than the large from the other seller. We will only be buying these from now on. The size is amazing, it feels super sturdy and it sits higher off the ground as well so when it gets broken in, my three 100lb dogs fat a**es won’t touch the ground. Stellar product definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cora Brainard

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Cooling Elevated Pet Bed
feature_bullets: Breathable mesh fabric helps keep pets cool by allowing air to flow
Elevates pets more than 7 inches off the ground
Easy to clean (using tap water only); simple assembly (screws and hex tool included)
Size L; measures 51.3 by 31.5 by 7.6 inches; backed by an AmazonBasics 1-year limited warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
